intro: Clausia hispida var. leiocarpa, commonly known as the smooth-hairless clausia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed or open habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
